description_html:
SIXINCH presents a unique line of chairs and tables called Tauko. Designed by Mac Stopa, the Tauko collection is inspired by designs from the 1950s and 1960s that match the home office
design trend perfectly.

The collection is characterized by soft, aesthetically pleasing organic shapes and high-quality wooden elements. The unique modular table is composed of a base consisting of three legs in solid beech and an organic-shaped top in HP laminate resembling a scalloped guitar pick.

The table’s unique geometry allows for multiple tessellations, allowing the users to determine the best table configuration adjusting it to the functionality, size and type of space. Triangular, hexagonal, linear, u-shape or auditorium configurations based on connecting several identical modular tables make Tauko one of the most versatile and flexible tables in today’s contract market.

The invisible connection mechanism under the table top ensures easy-to-connect and stable configurations. In addition to the table’s modularity and ganging system, the table is stackable, making it a perfect fit for meeting and conference rooms, training rooms, classrooms and public spaces.
product_name: Tauko Modular Table by Mac Stopa
